description: First-semester music majors begin formal musicianship studies. Students perform basic
melodies and rhythms at sight, and notate dictations of basic rhythms, melodies and harmonic
progressions. Students also analyze and compose Western tonal music employing the rubrics
of rhythm and meter, pitch, intervals, scales, tertian chords, inversions, harmonic progression,
and SATB voice leading. Co-requisite: Music 161 Piano Class 1 (or placement into a higher level
of keyboard proficiency). Offered annually in the fall semester.
